meanings.definition: In a manner relating to the classification of organisms into categories.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study organisms taxonomically to understand their relationships.
meanings.sent2: She organized the plants taxonomically based on their similarities.
meanings.sent3: The zookeeper jokingly classified the animals taxonomically by their favorite foods.
meanings.sent4: In the world of books, the librarian taxonomically arranged the novels by genre.
meanings.sent5: The botanist taxonomically identified the new species of flower with precision.

meanings.definition: According to the principles or practices of taxonomy.
meanings.sent1: The biologist analyzed the DNA samples taxonomically to determine the species.
meanings.sent2: The museum curator cataloged the artifacts taxonomically for easy reference.
meanings.sent3: The chef playfully sorted the ingredients taxonomically before starting to cook.
meanings.sent4: The historian taxonomically organized the events of the war in a chronological order.
meanings.sent5: The astronomer taxonomically classified the stars based on their spectral characteristics.
